class.name: anywheresoftware.b4j.agraham.jfxtrascontrols.BreadcrumbBarWrapper
class.comment:
This object implements a BreadcrumbBar that contains BreadcrumbItems and an optional Home item. BreadcrumbItems are displayed horizontally in the order in which they are added. Clicking any BreadcrumbItem removes both it and any items added after it with exception that the Home item is never removed if clicked.
The ItemAction event is raised when an item in the BreadcrumbBar is clicked.
The SceneBuilder name for this control is 'BreadcrumbBar'

method.name: AddItem
method.comment: Adds a new BreadcrumbItem to the end of the BreadcrumbBar and returns the new item.

method.name: RemoveItemAt
method.comment: Removes the BreadcrumbItem at index from the list of added items in the BreadcrumBar.

method.name: RemoveItem
method.comment: Removes the BreadcrumbItem from the list of added items in the BreadcrumBar.

method.name: AddHome
method.comment: Add a Home BreadcrumbItem to the left end of the BreadcrumbBar.

property.name: Items
property.comment: Returns a List containing all the BreadcrumbItems in the BreadcrumbBar.

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version number of the library.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4j.agraham.jfxtrascontrols.BreadcrumbBarWrapper.BreadcrumbItemWrapper
class.comment:
This BreadcrumbItem object can be added to a BreadcrumbBar. The only way of obtaining a BreadcrumbItem is from the return of BreadcrumbBar.AddItem. A BreadcrumbItem can display text, an image or both.
The SceneBuilder name for this control is 'BreadcrumbItem'

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initialize the BreadcrumbItem with the return value of BreadcrumbBar.AddItem.

property.name: IsFirst
property.comment: Returns True if this BreadcrumbItem is the first item in the bar it belongs to, False otherwise.

property.name: Text
property.comment: Gets the text of this BreadcrumbItem.

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version number of the library.

property.name: Icon
property.comment: Gets the icon of this BreadcrumbItem.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4j.agraham.jfxtrascontrols.BreadcrumbBarWrapper.BigDecimalFieldWrapper
class.comment:
This NumberUpDown control allows the user to specify a number. A number may be entered by the user and accepted by pressing the Enter key. The number may be spun up and down by the arrows using a step value set by the application program. The underlying type of the number is a BigDecimal. The NumberUpDown can format the number using a specified pattern.
A NumberChanged event is raised when the user changes the number.
The SceneBuilder name for this control is 'BigDecimalField'
class.event: NumberChanged(old As Double, new As Double) ' The number has been changed

method.name: Clear
method.comment: Clear the displayed value.

method.name: Decrement
method.comment: Increment the displayed value

method.name: Increment
method.comment: Decrement the displayed value

property.name: Format
property.comment: Gets or sets the Format property of the NumberUpDown with the specified pattern. Refer to the documentation for java.text.DecimalFormat for a description of patterns.

property.name: MinValue
property.comment: Gets or sets the MinValue property of the NumberUpDown

property.name: Number
property.comment: Gets or sets the Number property of the NumberUpDown

property.name: MaxValue
property.comment: Gets or sets the MaxValue property of the NumberUpDown

property.name: PromptText
property.comment: Gets or sets the prompt property of the NumberUpDown

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version number of the library.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4j.agraham.jfxtrascontrols.BreadcrumbBarWrapper.CalendarPickerWrapper
class.comment:
This DatePicker allows dates and times to be selected. It does not provide any events so some other mechanism will be needed for the user to indicate that the required selection has been made, most likely a custom modal dialog.
The SceneBuilder name for this control is 'CalendarPicker'

property.name: Mode
property.comment:
Gets or sets the mode of the DatePicker. Valid values are "SINGLE" - allows only a single date to be selected by clicking on it "RANGE" - allows a single range of dates to be selected bu Shift-Click on the second date "MULTIPLE" - allows multiple dates and date ranges to be selected.
Note that deselecting a date in MULTIPLE mode seems a little buggy, needing two clicks at times.

property.name: DateTime
property.comment: Gets or sets the date and time of the DatePicker as value in ticks.

property.name: ShowTime
property.comment: Gets or sets the ShowTime property of the DatePicker. This is only valid in SINGLE mode as this is the only mode where the time selector can be used.

property.name: TimeZone
property.comment: Sets the time zone offset of the DatePicker. This is only valid in SINGLE mode as this is the only mode where the time selector can be used.

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version number of the library.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4j.agraham.jfxtrascontrols.BreadcrumbBarWrapper.CalendarTextFieldWrapper
class.comment:
This DateTextField allows dates and times to be selected and returned as a formatted text value. If the user hovers over the field a tooltip will pop up detailing how to enter values in the control.
A DateChanged event is raised when the user changes the date.
The SceneBuilder name for this control is 'CalendarTextField'
class.event: DateChanged(old As Long, new As Long) ' The date has been changed

property.name: DateFormat
property.comment: Gets or sets the format used to parse date strings. See this page for the supported patterns: <link>formats:|http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html</link>. The default pattern is MM/dd/yyyy (04/23/2002 for example).

property.name: DateTime
property.comment: Gets or sets the date and time of the DateTextField as value in ticks.

property.name: TimeZone
property.comment: Sets the time zone offset of the DateTextField.

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version number of the library.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4j.agraham.jfxtrascontrols.BreadcrumbBarWrapper.CalendarTimePickerWrapper
class.comment:
This TimePicker allows a time to be selected. It does not provide any events so some other mechanism will be needed for the user to indicate that the required selection has been made, most likely a custom modal dialog.
The SceneBuilder name for this control is 'CalendarTimePicker'

method.name: SetTimeZone
method.comment: Sets the time zone offset of the TimePicker.

property.name: ShowLabels
property.comment: Gets or sets the ShowLabels property of the TimePicker.

property.name: Time
property.comment: Gets or sets the time of the TimePicker as a ticks value

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version number of the library.

property.name: MinuteStep
property.comment: Gets or sets the minute step property of the TimePicker.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4j.agraham.jfxtrascontrols.BreadcrumbBarWrapper.CalendarTimeTextFieldWrapper
class.comment:
This TimeTextField allows times to be selected and returned as a formatted text value. If the user hovers over the field a tooltip will pop up detailing how to enter values in the control.
A TimeChanged event is raised when the user changes the time.
The SceneBuilder name for this control is 'CalendarTimeTextField'
class.event: TimeChanged(old As Long, new As Long) ' The time has been changed

property.name: ShowLabels
property.comment: Gets or sets the ShowLabels property of the TimeTextField.

property.name: DateTime
property.comment: Gets or sets the date and time of the TimeTextField as value in ticks.

property.name: TimeZone
property.comment: Sets the time zone offset of the TimeTextField.

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version number of the library.

property.name: TimeFormat
property.comment: Gets or sets the format used to parse time strings. See this page for the supported patterns: <link>formats:|http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html</link>. The default pattern is HH:mm:ss (23:45:12 for example).

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4j.agraham.jfxtrascontrols.BreadcrumbBarWrapper.ListSpinnerWrapper
class.comment:
This ListSpinner control allows the user to select from a List of strings. The List may be maintained by adding to and removing from the default List of the ListSpinner. ListSpinner implements most of the methods of a B4J List to enable this to done in a familiar way. Otherwise a ready built B4J List that must contain only Strings may be assigned to the controls Items property.
The ListSpinner may be editable or read-only. If editable then when the user enters a new string the AddCallback event is raised passing the new string as a parameter. The AddCallBack event Sub should return an int value that is the index of the item to be displayed to the user.
The Cycle event is raised when the control wraps round in either direction. The ItemChanged event is raised when the user changes the displayed item.
The SceneBuilder name for this control is 'ListSpinner'
class.event: Cycle 'The Cylic property is True and the user has cycled from one end of the list to the other
AddCallBack(Item As String) 'The ListSpinner is Editable and the user has entered a new item into the ListSpinner
ItemChanged(old As String, new As String) ' The value has been changed

method.name: Sort
method.comment: Sorts the list.

method.name: IndexOf
method.comment: Returns the index of the specified item, or -1 if it was not found.

method.name: AddAll
method.comment: Adds all elements in the specified collection to the end of the list.

method.name: Clear
method.comment: Removes all the items from the list.

method.name: SortCaseInsensitive
method.comment: Sorts the list ignoring the characters case.

method.name: RemoveAt
method.comment: Removes the item at the specified index.

method.name: Add
method.comment: Adds an item at the end of the list.

method.name: Get
method.comment: Gets the item in the specified index. The item is not removed from the list.

method.name: Set
method.comment: Replaces the current item in the specified index with the new item.

method.name: InsertAt
method.comment: Inserts the specified Item in the specified index. As a result all items with index larger than the specified index are moved.

method.name: AddAllAt
method.comment: Adds all elements in the specified collection starting at the specified index.

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version number of the library.

property.name: ArrowsPosition
property.comment: Gets or sets the position of the arrows. Valid values are "LEADING" - positions both arrows to the left of the ListSpinner. "SPLIT" - positions the above/below or left.right according to the value of VerticalArrows. "TRAILING" - positions both arrows to the right of the ListSpinner.

property.name: Size
property.comment: Returns the number of items in the list.

property.name: Cyclic
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the ListSpinner cycles to the beginning when the user gets to the last item.

property.name: Items
property.comment: Gets or sets a List containing the strings the user can select.

property.name: Value
property.comment: Gets or sets the value of the item that is currently being displayed to the user.

property.name: ArrowsVertical
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the ListSpinner arrows are vertically oriented..

property.name: Editable
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the user can enter new items.

property.name: Index
property.comment: Gets or sets the index in the List of the item that is to be displayed to the user.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4j.agraham.jfxtrascontrols.BreadcrumbBarWrapper.XYControlWrapper
class.comment:
This XYControl control allows the user to graphically specify a set of X and Y co-ordinates.
A XChanged event is raised when the user changes the X value. A YChanged event is raised when the user changes the Y value.
The SceneBuilder name for this control is 'XYControl'
class.event: XChanged(old As Double, new As Double) ' The X value has been changed
YChanged(old As Double, new As Double) ' The Y value has been changed

property.name: XAxisLabel
property.comment: Gets or sets the value of the X axis label

property.name: YAxisLabelVisible
property.comment: Gets or sets the visibility of the Y axis label

property.name: XAxisLabelVisible
property.comment: Gets or sets the visibility of the X axis label

property.name: YAxisLabel
property.comment: Gets or sets the value of the Y axis label

property.name: Position
property.comment: Gets or sets the X and Y value of XYControl using a Double(2) array. Index 0 is the X value and index 1 is the Y value.

property.name: Y
property.comment: Gets or sets the Y value of the XYControl

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version number of the library.

property.name: X
property.comment: Gets or sets the X value of the XYControl

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4j.agraham.jfxtrascontrols.BreadcrumbBarWrapper.WindowWrapper
class.comment:
JFXtrasWindow is a window node as known from Swing, e.g javax.swing.JInternalFrame. It can be used to realize MDI based applications
The SceneBuilder name for this control is 'Window'
class.event: Closing 'The window is about to close'
Minimizing 'The window is about to restore or minimize'
IconAction 'A custom icon has been clicked'

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the JFXtrasWindow. If, like me, you don't like all this time-wasting twee animation stuff you can disable the naff close animation by passing True to noCloseAnimation. Regrettably the minimize animation is buried too deep in the default Window skin code to easily modify.

method.name: AddMinimizeIcon
method.comment: Add a Minimize icon to the window, on the left if onleft is true otherwise on the right.

method.name: Close
method.comment: Command the Window to close itself. Once a Window has closed you cannot reopen it but must recreate it.

method.name: AddIcon2
method.comment: Add a Custom icon to the window, on the left if onleft is true otherwise on the right. Clicking this icon raises an IconAction event. This icon appears as an anti-clockwise arrow.

method.name: AddIcon1
method.comment: Add a Custom icon to the window, on the left if onleft is true otherwise on the right. Clicking this icon raises an IconAction event. This icon appears as a rounded square.

method.name: AddCloseIcon
method.comment: Add a Close icon to the window, on the left if onleft is true otherwise on the right.

property.name: Movable
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the Window is movable.

property.name: Resizable
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the Window is resizable.

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version number of the library.

property.name: ContentPane
property.comment: Gets or sets the content pane of the Window. The default content pane is a StackPane but you can replace it.

property.name: Minimized
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the Window is minimized.

property.name: Selected
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the Window is selected.

property.name: ResizableBorderWidth
property.comment: Gets or sets the width of the resizable border of the Window.

property.name: Title
property.comment: Gets or sets the title of the Window.

property.name: Selectable
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the Window is selectable.

property.name: TitleBarStyleClass
property.comment: Gets or sets the css style class of the title bar of the Window.

root.comment:
This library contains additional controls from JFXtras Labs. JFXtraBreadcrumbBar, JFXtraBreadcrumbItem, JFXtraNumberUpDown, JFXtraDatePicker, JFXtraTimePicker and JFXtraListSpinner. This library uses the jfxtras-labs-2.2-r5.jar library from <link>JFXtras Labs|http://jfxtras.org</link>. This is the direct link to <link>jfxtras-labs-2.2-r5.jar|http://central.maven.org/maven2/org/jfxtras/jfxtras-labs/2.2-r5/jfxtras-labs-2.2-r5.jar</link>
To integrate these controls with SceneBuilder you need to manually add this line to your fxml layout file after the existing set of imports at the start of the file. Note that in the following lines I've used [ and ] instead of greater and less than characters to ensure the lines are not treated as mark-up in the help.
[?import jfxtras.labs.scene.control.*?]
Then in SceneBuilder add a simple control, TextArea is a good one, and name with a Node Id for B4J. Position and size the controls and do the same for any other controls you want then close SceneBuilder. Manually edit the fxml again by finding the TextArea lines
[TextArea id="Battery1" layoutX="49.0" layoutY="173.0" prefHeight="106.0" prefWidth="105.0" wrapText="true" /] and change 'TextArea' to the required type and remove 'wrapText' [XYControl id="XYControl1" layoutX="49.0" layoutY="173.0" prefHeight="106.0" prefWidth="105.0" /] SceneBuilder type names are specified in the xml help for each control
When you next start SceneBuilder it will want a path to the unknown controls. Check "Set up classpath", click the "+ Jar..." button and locate jfxtras-labs-2.2-r5.jar. Click "Apply" and "Close". You will have to do this each time you restart SceneBuilder, although the path will be already selected, but for some reason SceneBuilder will not automatically use it.
The controls should now be visible in SceneBuilder and also visible to "Generate Members" in B4J.
JFXtras and JFXtras Labs are licensed under the <link>New BSD License|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BSD_licenses</link>. Copyright (c) 2013, JFXtras All rights reserved.
This library is therefore also licensed under the New BSD License.
root.author: Andrew Graham
